bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 105 (Tuesday, June 21, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. O'HALLERAN:H.R. 8162.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 18, section 8 of article 1 of the Constitution[Page H5734]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation and Forestry.
Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

summary.text:
Forest Service Law Enforcement Enhancement Act of 2022

This bill directs the Forest Service to (1) fill all vacancies in the Forest Service Law Enforcement and Investigations organization; and (2) upon filling such vacancies, increase the number of positions available in such organization.

The Forest Service must prioritize filling vacancies and increasing the number of positions that (1) are at high or very high risk of wildfires, and (2) are areas of substantial public use.

bill.title: Forest Service Law Enforcement Enhancement Act of 2022

item.title: Forest Service Law Enforcement Enhancement Act of 2022
Forest Service Law Enforcement Enhancement Act of 2022
To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to fill vacancies and increase the number of positions available in the Forest Service Law Enforcement and Investigations organization, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation and Forestry.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
